item.title: OneStepAtATime
item.author: PixelZerg
item.description:
Like I mentioned in a previous post, I'm actually going to do this project sireously now. First of all, let's start by taking things one step at a time. As it stands, I'm probably not going to be able to do a wide a range of coding languages that I intended to.

Let's start with one basic program, such as a Hello World program for all of the coding languages I wan't to try first, and then we'll expand from there.

Most programmers will make a Hello World application. I'm not "most programmers". So let's come up with a "first program" of our own:

The Higher or Lower Game

This is going to be my "first program". It has the same real-world use as a Hello World program, but it's just slightly more interesting.

You've probably heard of or played this game before, but just in case, here's how it works:

A random number is generated. User tries to guess the number. Computer tells user if they were too high or too low. Keep guessing untill they get the number...

Pseudocode

Here's a basic implementation of it in pseudocode: 


set num = Rand.Next(0, 1000);
set done = false;
do
{
input = GetInput().ToInteger();
    if(input Equals num)
    {
    set done = true
    print("Cngrtz")
    break
    }
    if input greater than num
    {
    print("Too high")
    }
    if input less than num
    {
    print("Too Low")
    }



}
while(not done);

item.title: Universal Program - Briefing
item.author: PixelZerg
item.description:
Here's a cool project i'm starting. The aim is to port a single program into every coding language that I know. This is basically to familiarize myself with coding languages that I haven't done in a long time. I might even learn new coding languages just for this project. This is going to be great! But first, we must decide what the program must actually be.

Stuff That Must be Included

Menu

The program must contain a menu of some description with a list to select stuff included in the program. The user must be able to interact with the list and select items.

  • Orginisation
  • User Input
  • Printing
  • Basic Stuff

Loading

The program must display a loading animation. The loading percentage is also included in the console window's title.

  • Sleeping the Thread
  • Displaying Animation
  • Basic Text Stuff
  • Changing title

Hangman

There is a VERY BASIC hangman game included.

  • List/Array stuff
    • Check if List Contains Item
    • Make a list
  • Looks cool
  • Escaping text

Higher or Lower Game

A simple game. A random number is selected and the user must try to guess it. The program tells the user if they got the number right or it will tell them if the number they guessed was too high or too low.

  • Number Stuff
  • Checking if a number is greater than another number
  • parsing string into integer

Rectangle Drawer

The user will input X, Y co-ordinates and also Width and Height. The program will draw a rectangle.

  • graphics stuff
  • Getting User Input
  • While loops

Libs

The program asks the user for some words by their type (verb, adjective, noun, etc) and will then incorporate them into a story. This usually makes funny results. You can also save the generated story as a .txt file or other formats.

  • writing to a file
  • basic variable usage

NB

Note that not all of these features will be able to be implemented due to restrictions of the coding language itself and other restrictions. You may notice that the functionality of certain features vary in different coding languages due to said restrictions.

Time taken to write: 30 or so min.
